poem:
Title: "Essaouira Morning Rains"

Essaouira awakes, hushed by Atlantic winds,
Tawny sea whispers secrets to the deserted marketplace.
The rain taps an invitation against window panes-
An echo in empty souks, a playful nod to the absent windsurfers.
We wrap the morning in harira and honeyed bread,
Learning life in sheltered corners of Medina's kitchen.
What better way to greet a day's dawn,
Than with the taste of Morocco on our tongues.
